intro: Pachycalyx hispidus, commonly known as the rough-stemmed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically has palmately lobed leaves and produces bright yellow or orange flowers with a prominent central stigma. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Pachycalyx hispidus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
